Summary Heading: Worst hotel stay in a long time!
Summary: This is our first night here and there is no way we're completing our four night stay. I'm writing this review from the couch of the living area because I had to fold up the sofa bed to avoid injury from sleeping on the ancient concave mattress with the protruding coils. There are stains all over the carpet and bugs flying all over the room. Our room faces a courtyard and the noise outside is AWFUL, especially from the people delivering room service on a terribly loud rattling metal cart. Then there are the people talking, laughing, and yelling outside the paper-thin glass-paneled room doors.

My personal hope is that you may give us another opportunity in the future.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel..not so nice front desk
Summary: I love the layout of this hotel.  It honestly looks like you are in a forest.  Just not so happy with the front desk...they need to be more professional.  We requested two nearby rooms and they were on totally different floors.   The receptionist wasn't even really apologetic.

Summary: I would give it 3.5 stars if I could but rounded up because my expectations were much lower from the previous reviews.  This was my 3rd stay at this hotel over the last 5 years and would give 5 stars on those stays.  I have read previous reviews of guest who stays previous and didn't like the hotel anymore, so I was nervous.  Pros - price, garden area, pool, kitchenettes, free shuttle to Disneyland, 2 room suites.  Cons - cleanliness, no free breakfast anymore.   I could do without the free breakfast as I brought oatmeal to eat in the room before we left for Disneyland.  The cleanliness was kind of gross - it really was mainly the bathroom that was clean.  I try not to think much about it.

Summary Heading: Used to love the place but not anymore
Summary: This has been my go-to hotel for my SoCal trips for years, but the latest trip has really been a disappointment. Actually, I'm still checked in, but had I not already prepaid my entire stay, I would have checked out and found another place. First of all, we checked in and our bathroom was missing a shower curtain. We were on the 4th floor, and there was no ice machine for that floor. Went up and down all floors to find that none of the ice machines worked. After the first night, w went out and returned to find that the room was cleaned but housekeeping did not bother to replace any of our towels. I had to call three times within a span of three hours to finally get some, and they sent two large towels when we booked the room for three people. I mean, really? I paid $170 a night

Summary: I booked this hotel using Hotwire Hot Rates for a conference I was attending. This hotel was super accommodating. They had no problem getting us in a non-smoking 2 bedroom room even though we booked through a third party. The rooms themselves are gorgeous, though the carpet and the couches are a bit dated. We had issues with the hot water going out which is the only reason I did not give this property a 5. It was nice to have a separate living area with fridge/wetbar  The pool and hot tub area are great. The lobby contains a gift shop and several computers for guests to use which is nice. The internet was a decent speed too, which is rare for hotels. The onsite restaurant is okay, nothing special, but there are several other dining options near by. The hotel is right next door

Summary: Having had our travel agent book this place and then reading some of the reviews I was a little apprehensive about staying there.  Was quite surprised upon reaching our room how clean and tidy it was.  Yes the decor is dated and tired but for somewhere to sleep etc it suited our needs very well. Breakfast was average with selection same each day. Staff were always helpful even down to fixing a blocked toilet at 11pm. Location is handy to knotts berry farm and several eating establishment's like BK Maccas etc. Disney shuttle very handy.

Summary: We stayed 5 days at this hotel and were pleased with our stay.  The staff was incredibly helpful, especially Ray, one of the maintenance staff.  One person in our party needed a wheelchair accessible room.  When we asked to have another grab bar installed, they did it right away, just where we needed it. The ambiance is pleasant, and the landscaping provided a quiet oasis from the noisy city.  I only wish I hadn't seen dead bees and ladybugs in the gardens, because that probably means they are using a neonicotinoid insecticide on the premises.

We value our guests regardless of how their reservation is made.  The bus situation seemed very inconvenient for you too, along with the situation with room service.

Summary: This hotel is really overrated. Be prepared for a huge disappointment. Even though it is cheap this hotel is not a good deal. The rooms are really old with plenty of mold and bugs. The rooms are not very private and shades on the glass doors almost falls off. We will probably change to a better hotel tomorrow.
Manager Response: Thank you for posting comments on TripAdvisor that will help us improve our product and service.  We're sorry that you had problems with pests and blinds that were less than satisfactory.

Summary Heading: Disgusting does not begin to describe this hotel!
Summary: My family and I recently booked a one night stay with two rooms. A homeless man had taken out the dumpster trash and thrown it all over the parking lot. A man was in his car doing drugs. Sadly, we still went inside. The building was run-down, but we proceeded to the rooms. One of the rooms had no towels, the shower curtains were missing and the beds were not made. Instead the sheets were bundled up and thrown on the bed. There were people sleeping outside of the rooms. There were also random women hanging outside the rooms. It seemed like the establishment was running an hourly rate! We did try to call the manager; however, the phones did not work. They offered to change our room, and a sweaty man with his shirt half buttoned tried to give us keys. The manager did offer a free
Manager Response: We're sorry that you encountered people at our hotel in the parking lot that obviously didn't belong there.  We will also investigate the situation about people sleeping outside and guests "hanging around".  Security is indeed a priority for us.  Housekeeping has also been made aware of the towel comment that you made as well.

Summary: I would not recommend this hotel and am extremely shocked at Radisson's lack of standards,service and quality. No towels  at pool. Daily same breakfast and very less choice in food even after hotel is fully occupied. The only plus point is location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I would not recommend this hotel and am extremely shocked at Radisson's lack of standards and quality for the product it sells. First off, my husband found an open condom wrapper in the drawer of the nightstand with greasy marks in the drawer. As if not gross enough, about 10 minutes into our experience the toilet made noises and shot water out flooding the floor. We switched rooms after that. Now, in the new room, I'm up in the middle of the night because the inside room temp won't go down, it's 75 degrees in the room, while the ac won't go down to a lower setting of 68. It doesn't matter because the ac can't seem to get down past 75. Called the front desk and they said they'll check their system, but the temp should be going down. Half hours past, and it feels the same. So
Manager Response: We apologize for the linen challenges you had during your recent stay with us.  Please know that we are working hard to make improvements in the overall cleanliness of our facility, with particular emphasis on towels and other room amenities.

Summary Heading: Good location, check!..... Great value, check!
Summary: After much homework involving reading countless tripadvisor reviews, photos and online information about the many properties on offer in the Anaheim/Buena Park area, our family of 4 decided this property suited our needs just nicely. After all, it's a long way to travel from the west coast of Australia to the US (19hrs over 2 flights!) only to discover the property you are about to make your home for 6 days is nothing like you expected. Well, I am happy to report the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park delivers exactly what it promises, nothing more, nothing less. This property is well located and very easy to find (we threw caution to the wind and hired a car from LAX, we Aussies are good drivers) and we arrived about 30 mins prior to the allocated check-in time. Reception
Manager Response: none

Summary: Where to start???  Well, I guess we can start with the Pros  Location Price  That's about it.   Now, on to the Cons.  We arrived to our room, to a warm, musty smelling, damp feeling welcome. The air was not on, and although SoCal weather is normally nice. This room was overly humid the entire time, and the only way to help with that was to run the A/C on 68 (the lowest it would go) the entire time. A quick check of the A/C filters showed piles of dirt on them from months of not being serviced. The small fridge in the room was also not on, so the groceries we bought had to sit out until it cooled down.  We immediately noticed the gnats flying around, but hoped that they would eventually go away. We were wrong. In fact, they were joined by a couple of spiders, and a few
Manager Response: Thank you for using TripAdvisor to let us know about your lack of satisfaction with your recent stay with us.  Noisy neighbors are somewhat difficult to manage, however, we attempt to make sure that we respond to noise complaints as quickly as we receive them.  Housekeeping and Engineering have received your list of deficiencies, in an effort to rectify challenges with room supplies, air conditioning issues and bed cleanliness.

Summary: Terrible stay from day one. The room was musty and damp, numerous gnats, spiders, and silverfish, damaged and unusable dresser drawers.  The bedskirt and shower curtain had holes in them and the pull-out sofa bed had a huge stain on the mattress.Gross! The two double beds were springy and not comfortable at all. The air filter inside the room looked as though it had not been changed for six months or longer which probably contributed to the bad smell. While bracing my arm on the hand rail in the shower it crumbled and fell into the tub. Parking is free but management blocked off large parts of the lot for tour buses making parking a hassle. The pool was closed for two days on our stay which turned into a blessing because the noise was ridiculous and kids run about hours after
Manager Response: We appreciate your candor about your recent stay at our hotel.  Please accept our apologies for any inconveniences you encountered.  Our Housekeeping and Engineering staffs have both received your complaints-with emphasis on having the right supplies available, the stains you mentioned and the shower that needs repair.  Managing noise can sometimes be a challenge-we do our best to attempt to patrol the entire building as often as possible.

Summary: The manager at front desk was horrible never smiled the whole time we were there and we were there for 7 days asked for change for washroom he said he only had $3.00 looked in all draws he told me to go ask the gift shop they had 5.00 worth then went back to the front desk and ask the lady that was there and she gave me $5.00 worth so it made him look like a liar. I didn't ask him for anything else, I went to somebody else when I needed something he needs training in customer service. They need to trim all those dead trees by the pool area, it is a nice area if they keep it cleaned. The room was ok saw a lot of workers always on there phones. They need to train there workers to say hello when they see guest I mean after all we are paying their salary or even just smile. I am
Manager Response: We're very sorry that you had trouble with our Front Desk Manager.  Generally, we receive plenty of cheerful comments about the professionalism he provides.  However, we'll share your comments with him so he can attempt to improve his service skills.  Thank you for let us know about employees talking on their phones...a definite no-no.

Summary Heading: Housekeeping needs to leave towels in room.
Summary: I stayed at the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park, CA last week. When we cked in there was only 3 towels in the room.  It went downhill from there, next day it was 2 towels and they didn't replace the toilet paper in the bathroom.  I came back very late at night and had to go downstairs to tell the front office about it.  When I ck'd in the phone didn't work and they never fixed it.  I wouldn't care much about the phone but when you come back and have no towels it would be nice to be able to pick up the phone and call.  After that I would come back and there was no towels in the room.  We would leave a couple of them up to dry out, but the maids would take them and leave no more.  They even stole some of the gum I had left on the counter top.  Breakfast wasn't to bad but the MAID
Manager Response: Please accept our apologies for the Housekeeping issues you encountered during your recent stay with us.  We've forwarded your comments to that department's management so they can take steps to make sure that towels are delivered promptly during service.

Summary Heading: Horrible Stay...Not worth it and NOT close to Disney
Summary: We stayed at the Buena Park Radisson Suites from June 21st-23rd of 2014.  It was absolutely awful.  The room had soil stains on the carpet upon entrance, the sleep number beds did not work and my oldest slept on the pullout couch and said he felt nothing but springs and a bar in his back all night.  When I went to take a shower, I looked up and there was MOLD on the ceiling.  We tried to take the elevator down from the third floor to the first floor and it took us up instead.  Then once on the third floor pushed the level one button and it took us back to the third floor again.  In speaking with someone else in the hotel, they said they experienced the exact same thing earlier in the day.  We were so exhausted from running around Disney all day to switch out rooms.  I can
Manager Response: Thank you for using TripAdvisor to let us know about the disappointing aspects of your stay at the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park.  We apologize for the bathroom conditions, the state of the carpet and elevator trouble.  Please know that we will research and resolve these issues so they do not happen in the future.

Summary: I would give the Staff a 5 STAR, everyone from the front desk, to the tram driver behaved like they want you to have a good time.  The hotel itself needs a little help.  The furnishings need some refreshing, the refrigerator in my daughter's room went out and was replace within the hour.   The entry doors are lovely glass french doors that face the pool area with wooden blinds to block the view when you want privacy.  Unfortunately we needed the keys on all three rooms re-keyed sometimes several times a day over the course of the 4 day stay.  The sliding glass door in the bedroom in 2 of the 3 rooms was off track and almost impossible to close once opened so of course we had to use air conditioning the entire stay.  The hotel boiler, that heated the hotel's water went out our
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I recently booked a trip to disneyland and choose this hotel based on the great reviews. I would like to say first I never write reviews but in this case I had to let other travelers know how disappointing this hotel was. Old hotel and very POOR customer service. Our checkin was about a 20 minute wait and we were the only people in the lobby, every time we called the front desk it was another 20 min hold time on the phone because "they are extremely busy" The shuttle was a joke, very small and if full you must wait for the next one which was an hour later. Had to take a taxi to get back after a long day at Disney and paid $25 for a 6 mile trip back because there shuttle was full. Both the refrigerator and microwave provided in the room didn't work, that was
Manager Response: We apologize for inconvenience with the shuttle and room electronics during your recent stay in our hotel.  We've passed on your feedback to our Engineering department to make sure those items are inspected prior to guests checking into the room.

Summary: Older style hotel. Clean but rather unaccommodating. You have to book your shuttle to Disney and they only go one time per hour and if the shuttle is booked you are out of luck! Times for shuttle are not great either! That made the trip disappointing. Also, the city ART bus only runs until 9 PM. I would not stay here for the purpose of Disney again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Customer services at hotel frontdesk and breakfast hall are very disappointing and poor
Summary: Pros: Location good as near Disneyland and eateries.  Cons: Poor services from reception desk. Informed them thrice on the room phone that no external calls could get through, and they tested to comfirm my feedback. Sadly, after 2 nights stay, they did not bother to fix the problem. Breakfast was a nightmare as there are shortages of utensils and even after request for the utensils to their staff, nothing heard thereafter. It's a great pity to let such poor customer services ruined otherwise a decent family hotel.
Manager Response: On behalf of the entire staff, we're sorry that your recent stay at our hotel was less than satisfactory.  Your comments have been forwarded to our Front Office Manager and Director of Food and Beverage to ensure that these types of occurences do not happen in the future.  Regardless of the physical state of the hotel, our goal is always to provide first class service.

Summary: I'll keep this short.   The good: Pretty nice looking property, beautiful atrium/pool area, descent WiFi, nice free breakfast buffet, & so-so rooms.   The bad: Couch looks like it's from the 80's, stained and tattered. Select Comfort beds work poorly, and even when they work well they're just an air mattress with padding on top. Automatic light switches in the bathroom, with means that leaving the light on to be sure you'll find the bathroom at night in a strange environment is in vain (move a lamp from the room in there to prevent issues, especially with small kids). Other issues include poorly patched tile work in the shower, sketchy elevators, and a pool with short hours (yes, they will ask you to leave if your past their closing time).   The worst: I had seen reviews that
Manager Response: Your feedback here on TripAdvisor is very much appreciated.  We're sorry that you had some inconveniences while you were with us.  We have plans to make our property better than ever, and we hope you'll reconsider us in the future.  Sofas in bad condition certainly aren't what we strive to present to our customers.  Unfortunately, pool hours are tough to manage because guests who are ready to retire around 10pm aren't the ones who want to continue to enjoy the pool.  We're sorry that we have to enforce the rules.  We're glad that you enjoyed the breakfast and the Wi-fi.

Summary Heading: Very Good for a Family Stay
Summary: If you are planning to visit both Anahiem and Universal together, this hotel is a good option for family with kids. Well appointed rooms, kids friendly swimming pool and decent pricing, works well for this nice hotel. Also located close to some Buena Park attractions like Medieval Times as well as plenty of next door food options Indian, Korean, Subway, Mcdonald and mexican.  Suites are very well appointed and breakfast ( charged at USD 8.50 per adult and USD 5 per child) is also good. The hotel also has free buses to Disney park and local attractions (prior reservations required).
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not as good as they could be
Summary: We were traveling in a large group and had over 20 rooms. This hotel was chosen because of the suites and fitting in more people. If you choose to sleep on the sleeper sofa, and are near the pool, you won't get any sleep until the pool closes. If you use just the bedroom, you can close the door to the front room and get more peace. The hotel is just trying to be a hotel and isn't focused on customer satisfaction. If they run out of shuttle space, they don't do additional runs, you are just out of luck if you don't reserve the shuttle first. It is a good looking hotel. My room was clean, but some things were annoying. The water facet in the kitchenette only had cold water, and it was attached to the hot water control, if you open the one labeled cold then nothing came out. They
Manager Response: none

Summary: It's more like a resort stay and provides complimentary shuttle to and fro Disneyland. You need to make prior arrangement with the check in counter.  Have some problems in opening the room door and have changed 4 different room keys. Hotel staff was obliging and maintenance guy came promptly for assistance. However I would suggest to make gradual upgrades for the room doors as it's quite frustrating to be locked out of the doors.  Hotel buffet is pretty limited but it is complimentary with my tour package so we just make do with it.  Nearby the hotel, there is a Starbucks and 24 hour macdonalds and some Korean and japanese restaurants etc.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Really good sleep, but other items disappointed
Summary: Bed was very comfortable, so met my first priority as was there on business - a really good sleep.  In room Directory was not updated, so does NOT include Comp. Breakfast.  Toilet was running constantly, so managed to fix myself as always needed to remove toilet tank cover in order to allow the cap to close after flushing. Bedroom telephone never worked & they did not send Engineering after I asked for it, when out all day for work. Was nice could order a drink & take back to my room. Pool was filled with loud kids & naturally, the water was dirty & cloudy if open your eyes.  Afraid, will not return to this hotel & am in the Hotel business myself.
Manager Response: Your comments are very appreciated regarding your recent stay with us.  We're sorry that you had toilet issues in your suites, and that the pool did not meet your expectations.  Thankfully it sounds like the bedding was acceptable, and would hope you would consider visiting us again in the future.

Summary: Great tropical pool and jacuzzi courtyard! Rooms are suites with master bedroom and TV and a door separating with a shard bathroom. Then a pullout couch and TV and little kitchenette. Across the street from Knotts berry farm. The rates were very reasonable too!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I usually do not write reviews, but because I had depended on user reviews of this hotel when I booked my trip, I feel that its only fair to let people know. This was a very bad hotel experience. It is suppose to be a 3 star hotel based on ratings. But after staying there for 4 nights, this is definitely not 3 star quality! More like 1 star! The hotel suite is DIRTY!! My son has gotten an infection from something that probably bit him while sleeping. The carpeting is dirty. Room reeks of some kind of weird smell. Bathtub had hair on in from last visitors. The sink in the bathroom was clogged and it took a long time for the water to drain.  My husband sat on the sofa and said he felt itchy. In all, this is a very filthy hotel. I am VERY sorry I had booked there! I only booked it
Manager Response: Your review on TripAdvisor was very troubling to read, and I'm very sorry for all of the inconveniences that you encountered when you stayed with us last month.  I have discussed these cleanliness issues with our Housekeeping department to ensure that these types of issues are the exception to our normal guideliness of guest satisfaction.  Bathroom conditions are extremely important in a guest's stay, along with not having an odor problem.  Thank you for bringing these items to our attention.

Summary: This was our second time staying at this property.  The rooms are comfortable, the staff is very helpful.  When we had stayed in the past breakfast was included in your room rate.  It was a very good hotel breakfast.  The property still provides a breakfast at an additional cost.  But, we traveled to a nearby Denny's that was reasonable with a good number of choices.  The only issues I encountered were challenges with printing boarding passess and noisy guests in the room above.  There are two computers in the lobby.  I used the one on the left to log onto the airline's website and complete the check-in process.  When done I selected print and no boarding passes appeared.  I asked about this at the desk and was told that only the computer on the right is connected to the
Manager Response: none

Summary: I did reserved for 5 nights and checked out just after 1 night stay. First things I found when stepped in a room, there was a big,,8x10 sized hole in the screen door.and drawers in the chest kept opening no matter what i did.And the waster basin in bathroom was so clogged,it took a  long time to drain. I found the phone in the bedroom was totally dead when I tried to call the front desk.  I could not open or close the bathroom door without waking up my wife who was sleeping.The door definitely needs  lubricating.    In the morning, I found cigarette butts and ashes on the hallway to the elevator.It was really disgusting when I found mound of cigarettes butts on the ground.I decided to check out.The manager said it was a smoking areas, But even smoking areas does not have to
Manager Response: I apologize on behalf of the entire staff for your less than satisfactory stay at the hotel.  Your comments are very much appreciated, and they will be shared with our Front Office, Housekeeping and Engineering departments.  Deficiencies like furnture drawers opening, slow drains and litter in the public areas should be rectified immediately.  Again, I'm sorry that you had this experience but hope you might visit us again in the future.

Summary Heading: Close to Knotts Berry Farm. Otherwise: meh
Summary: This hotel has potential -- true suite rooms that look good on the surface, pretty grounds build around an outdoor pool, a quick walk from Knotts Berry Farm. But it's past its prime, not all that well run and darned noisy. The floor above us and our floor were creaky and thin, making our room a drum when the kids above rambled around. There was a dead cockroach under the sofa We waited 20 minutes to check in at 8 p.m. on a Friday night -- no apology from the poor person manning the busy desk. Lots of little things bugged us: the bedroom TV didn't work, the printer next to the house computer didn't work, the lock on the pool gate that's supposed to work with a room key didn't work, no towels at the pool early on a Saturday night and no response when someone asked the desk to
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback here on TripAdvisor.  I'm sorry that we did not meet your expectations, but do hope that you will consider staying with us in the future.  It's awfully difficult to patrol guests when they are in and around the building but we can take steps to make sure things like printers and televisions work properly.  Again, your response is very much appreciated.

Summary: we stayed 4 nights, had stayed here when it was an embassy suites, we still love it here, the tropical garden is beautiful! the staff here are so helpful also the cooks in kitchen and bartender are great along with housekeeping. the negative was all hell broke loose when the bus loads of kids showed up 2 dys in a row, there was no enjoying the pool or hot tub after that! very noisy, the rooms face the pool which is lovely but it echos and when its filled with people which it was, it can be overwhelming. was disappointed that their free shuttle only runs to Disneyland a few hours a day, so we were stuck there for 7 hrs which was difficult for my husband with health issues. we didn't understand why the gift shop is closed all day, only open a short amount of time,when it was an
Manager Response: none

Summary: Really, 4 stars is a really good rating.  I just can't quite call this property "perfect" anymore.  The rooms remain well designed and very comfortable, and isn't that the most important thing?  But on this return visit, the Radisson Suites has too many nit-picky problems to just ignore them all.  So here goes:  Since new owners in 2013, breakfast is no longer included in most rates but I did not notice rates dropping as a result.  Room thermostats are unnecessarily complicated.  Don't even think of trying to make friends with it in the middle of the night.  Minor problems with inhouse speed dial on one of my room's two phones.  Water control in my shower needed very firm touch to fully shut it off.  Gift shop closes for the entire afternoon, leaving no snack options without
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Customer Service at the front desk was GREAT
Summary: I have to say thank you to the wonderful woman who allowed my husband and I to check in early after a long drive and a sleepless night for the hubby.  The suites are spacious, not large but good enough for 2 or a small family.  Living room area has sleeper sofa, compact fridge and sink and desk. Bedroom was comfy, linens were cool and crisp and i loved the extra large bath towels. The shower head could've been better but it was standard for most hotels. I did call housekeeping to ask if they had a fullsize blowdryer and they never called me back. I had a broken ironing board which was replaced immediately. Now the down side: 1.  the walls must be paper thin because we could hear EVERYTHING our neighbors were doing the night before.  Im glad our children werent with us or i
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Filthy Room - Spider on the floor
Summary: I don't know who cleaned my room, as there was no note about who it was but there was a large stain on the carpet next to my bed on the right hand side.  Also, there was a dead spider in the bathroom that was obvious as soon as I walked into the bathroom.  The spider was in multiple pieces so it hadn't just died.  The sink was also stained and the microwave had not been cleaned out.  Despite telling the front desk, nothing was done even after I asked for another room.    Will never stay there again especially considering if I wanted to clean I would have stayed home and considering I spent $150.00 on the room.
Manager Response: We're sorry that you experienced a number of issues when you recently stayed with us.  In particular, we apologize for the spider, room conditions and the response (or lack thereof) by the Front Desk.  Please consider us in the future as there are exciting improvements coming our way.

Summary Heading: IMPOSSIBLE TO SLEEP - NO CUSTOMER SERVICE
Summary: It was a horrible mistake to stay at this hotel.  There was constant noise from the guests all night long - including until 1:30 a.m.  The noise included gospel music playing above us due to the choir staying there.  When we called the front desk, Suman,  to have the noise stopped, after we had tolerated it for hours, he treated us as if we were an inconvenience.  He also informed us that the loud music was coming from a local nightclub burt the same music was playing again when we left the hotel and the nightclub was closed - hence confirmation of it being gospel music with a ver loud bass.    I sent an email to the general manager and the manager of the front desk as soon as we returned home on Sunday, as my husband and I went away for a relaxing stay but could not even sleep.
Manager Response: We're sorry that encountered a noise problem when you stayed in our hotel recently.  It's sometimes difficult to manage our neighbors but we try our best to work with them to understand our guests' needs of a good night's sleep.  We hope to see you in the future when you visit Buena Park.

Summary Heading: Beautiful and nice hotel for the right price
Summary: Nice hotel with beautiful garden/ courtyard pool area. Our room/ suite was quit big and the room was really clean. Staff was very friendly.  Only down side, our room was the last one on the end near the main road and although the general road noise did not bother us. However, if a large semi truck or someone bumpin the bass of their car music drove by you could it clear enough to know what song it is. But I wouldn't use this as a reason not to stay.  It was honestly a great hotel for the price we paid.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice Stay for a High School Choir
Summary: We stayed at the Radisson with a high school choir group.  Great access to a variety of places in the Los Angeles area.  Rooms were neat and clean, and we could have as many as six students in a room with the 2 double beds and a sleeper sofa.  The centralized outdoor pool area was unique and aesthetically pleasing.  Breakfast was great, with a variety of options.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Older hotel but nice and clean
Summary: We booked this hotel because we wanted to stay at a Radisson and this one was the only suite property so we booked it.  Only stayed for 2 nights.  The hotel is an older property but they keep it up well.  All the rooms open up into the courtyard overlooking the pool.  We never made it in the pool but it looked very nice.  They have a small gift shop inside the lobby and the majority of the stuff in there was Disney related.  Only 4 stories high, we were on the 4th floor and we never heard any of our neighbors on either side or below us.  We could hear shrieks and such coming from the pool area but it never bothered us at night so they must close the pool at a certain time. Really comfortable beds, slept great.  It was nice to have the 2 rooms and extra space for the 4 of us, 2
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm currently staying at this hotel. So dissatisfied with what I am experiencing. I didn't book this hotel my mother did. I am staying here in due part to my daughters birthday. The only quality thing here is the pool. I get that this is suppose to be a family location but the location, rooms, and property is horrible. Rooms are out dated, they still have wall hair dryers that do not dry anything (are you serious?). Furniture here is atrocious, I can hear the kids above me running around at 1am causing me not to sleep, they had people doing the yard work at 8am which made me even more grumpier. There are no decent restaurants in this area, bars or night life. I'm from Chicago, I work at a hotel in downtown Chicago, my expectations are of high quality.   The front desk had no
Manager Response: We're very sorry that your experience in the hotel was not up to your expectations.  While we aren't in an area like Chicago, Buena Park tries to cater to guests with all sorts of backgrounds and likes.  Our Front Desk staff can certainly do more to learn about the various options in our neighborhood, and we appreciate that suggestion.  Thank you also for the kind words about our pool area-it's a favorite among many of our guests.

Summary: The hotel is an ideal base to stay, being just across the road from Knotts Berry Farm theme park and having other attractions close by. I chose this accommodation as it is close to Disneyland and the hotel has a free shuttle bus to the park. It was nice just to walk up and down the road and check out what is nearby. We found the hand prints of Lou Ferrigno (The Hulk - tv series) amongst others outside the Movieland Wax Museum just across the road and enjoyed a meal at the Outback Steakhouse one evening. We could have done with spending a couple more nights here to check out the other attractions, but after a full day at Universal Studios and the Los Angeles evening tour, and taking one too many spinning rollercoasters at Knotts Berry Farm, you need some time just to chill out.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park is just ok.. we were booked here by a relative as the location is convenient for them to pick us up everyday. The hotel is very old, the lobby, hotel grounds and rooms shows signs of age, the carpet is old and worn but looks clean enough (though we did not dare step on the carpets barefoot), the beds were very comfortable and the room was big. We don't know how much they booked our rooms for but it should not be more than $120‚Ä¶ if it's more than that then it's not worth it for the very old, tired looking hotel and rooms
Manager Response: none

Summary: Five of us stayed in a 1 bedroom suite and there was so much room. Two TV's was also very nice with 3 kids. The garden view was beautiful, they really keep the grounds very nice. This hotel was very convenient to walk to Knotts Berry Farm. There is also a really unique McDonalds ( it has a large train set inside), Starbucks and other food places to eat. The morning buffet was definitely worth the $10, extra I paid online when booking through the hotel website (which included breakfast for everyone in room), the only downside were, when unfolding the couch bed there were some bits of food underneath, one of the towels in bathroom was stained really bad, even though it looked like it had been washed it definitely needed bleaching. Also we were awakened about 6:00am by the people
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean and comfortable suite....and so close to lots of attractions including walking distance to Knotts Berry Farm. Loved the room. Everyone was friendly. Will definitely be staying there again! Two large TVs in the suite. Beautiful place for families!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: TripAdvisor and Get a Room failed to process reservation properly
Summary: We traveled to Orange County for several events for the weekend, and stayed at the Buena Park Radisson Saturday night after a visit to Knott's Berry Farm.  We paid extra for a king bed suite through TripAdvisor and Get a Room.  When we got to the suite, it did not have a king bed as requested.  We lugged our bags back down to the front desk, where the clerk told us that Get a Room and TripAdvisor did not request a king bed.  Luckily we had a printed confirmation with us--otherwise we would have been out of luck.  The hotel was full up, and we waited fifteen minutes for him to find us a king suite.  Finally he found one but it was not made up, so we went to Black Angus for a pleasant dinner.  Returning to the hotel, we eventually got our room, two hours after we first arrived.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Ideal stay for Disneyland & Knotts Berry Farm
Summary: What a lovely hotel. All suites, far better than just a bedroom. Good looking building with enclosed courtyard featuring Pool and Jacuzzi. Very convenient for local attractions. Free courtesy bus to & from Disney about 5 miles away - and a much keener price than staying right next to Disney too.  Apart from Breakfast which gets 3/5 for ready cooked, not fresh food, although good variety, tasted banal.  Otherwise good hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay on our Spring Break Disneyland trip!
Summary: Our group of 6 stayed here for 3 nights last week during our spring break trip to California and had a wonderful experience! The Hotel staff was very helpful and answered all of our many questions. The free breakfast was good and we totally enjoyed the pool and hot tub at the end of the day! Beautiful grounds and clean rooms. I could nit pick a little bit and say it's in need of some small fixes and repairs... but we didn't mind at all. The smiles and fantastic attitude and service we received far surpassed any wear and tear issues with the room. The bedroom had a sleep number bed which really impressed my husband and we both slept well. It was nice to have breakfast included. Some of the bacon was more like jerky but overall the breakfast was fine. Our daughter had gotten sick on the road trip here so we had to used the laundry facilities. They worked great and the dryer was the best of
Manager Response: Hello LuvazTravel,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review concerning your recent stay with us at the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park.  We appreciate you choosing our hotel for your stay and for taking the time to inform fellow travelers about your experience. I am so pleased that you found the service, amenities, and complimentary breakfast to your liking.   I am sorry to read that your daughter was sick during your visit and that we didn't take that extra step to help you in regards to the trash can request. Please accept my apologies for your disappointment in that part of our customer service.   Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: Our trip was literally "Play and Run". We flew in late at night from NY, straight to Buena Park from the airport, so we could go straight to Disneyland in the morning and be there when the gates opened. I picked one of my favorite brands, the Radisson. Once again, they did not disappoint. We got in almost midnight. The lone desk clerk was so sweet, explaining the map and breakfast to me over and over (I was at 3am by then.) The hotel is built to look like an hacienda, with the balconies, the shuttered doors, the arches, with the garden and pool in the middle of the courtyard. There is ample parking. Breakfast was buffet style, and much better than I imagined. In this day and age of "boxed" buffet breakfasts, where pretty much everything they serve came out of the box, this hotel
Manager Response: Hello TwinmamaNYC,  Thank you for your recent stay at our hotel. I am glad you were able to enjoy our restaurant and that the property amenities were to your liking. We hope to see you return again soon.  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: We enjoyed staying at the radisson last weekend. The hotel is clean, the rooms are spacious, and the service is excellent. The gym could use a little updating, but we enjoyed our workout nonetheless.  The breakfast could offer more variety as well.  That said, we were satisfied given the price we paid. Another bonus was the free water and fruit basket in the room< huge satisfier!
Manager Response: Hi Coconino1,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. I am delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us but I do want to apologize for the lack of variety at the breakfast buffet and the exercise room being outdated.   We hope to welcome you back again soon, please let us know if there is anything we can accommodate for you during your next stay.  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: This was my second stay at this hotel, mid December 2012.  Once again, they provided exceptional service.  My wallet had been stolen at the airport, but since I was prepaid, they allowed me to go ahead and check in with just my business card, until my passport arrived the next day.  I was uncomfortable with a ground floor room (as they are right next to the parking lot), and they graciously allowed me to move to a 2nd floor room at the front of the building.  The rooms are spacious with a separate living area and sleeping area.  All doors open to a beautiful courtyard/pool area.  When you enter the room, there is a TV, dining table, couch and wet bar with mini frig.  The hallway has a door to the bathroom, also spacious.  As you continue back you come into the bedroom.  I had a
Manager Response: Hello Twowisekids,  Thank you for your review of our hotel. I am very pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us and the convenience of our location. We look forward to having you as our guest again and hope to see you in the near future.  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for families
Summary: We stayed for a few days. The breakfast was really good. The room was clean, and good sized. They are very friendly there. It seems like they all take pride in working there. It's hard to find a place that is this good, that isn't expensive! It's also close to everything.
Manager Response: Hello Golaryn,  Thank you very much for your recommendation of our hotel to other travelers. We are thrilled to hear that you had a great stay! Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback. We appreciate your excellent ratings and compliments on our customer service. It truly is our pleasure to assist our guests in any way we can. We hope to see you again on your next visit to the Cityof Buena Park!  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: My family stayed here for 7 nights to go to Disneyland, Dec'12-Jan'13 week. This old-Hollywood, Spanish style complex was so much prettier and vacation-like than the typical box hotel. Loved the design.  The rooms: clean and spacious. Comfy beds, pillows and pull out sofa.  Low flow toilets are the only thing I didn't like (personal insecurities is all).  Staff: Phenomenal. The front desk staff members were so kind, they made sure my and my parents rooms were adjacent so the kid can go back and forth easily. We even got a Welcome basket. Thanks so much!  Doaa in the lounge is AWESOME! She treats everyone like regulars, so friendly and funny. She made it great to stay after the Manager's special (usually pretty crowded because it's free drinks and apps from 5-7 M-Th). Speaking
Manager Response: Hello M J,  I would like to thank you for taking the time out of your busy day to write a review of the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park. We are very happy to hear that you really enjoyed your stay with us. We are very proud of our hotel grounds and take great pride in keeping them looking there best.   I will share your comments with Doaa (I agree, she is great and we are lucky to have her as part of our staff) as we like to acknowledge our staff members when they do a job well done. We look forward to having you stay with us again during your next stay in Buena Park.  Best Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: The staff is very friendly and this hotel is super close to Knotts Berry Farm, shopping and dining. Will stay here everytime I visit this area. Very clean and they offer a wonderful complimentary breakfast and other amenities that other hotels make you pay for. Highly recommended!
Manager Response: Hello Kahamp,  We are so pleased you enjoyed your stay with us! We realize you have a choice of hotels when visiting the Buena Park area, and appreciate that you choose the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park.  Thank you very much for the great review and for letting yoru fellow travelers know about your stay here with us.   Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: we stayed there in 2012 july.Its location is good for disney and many other theme parks Knot' Berry is in walking distance.Staff is good and  there is free breakfast.We enjoyed there.Everything is ok. We went to LA, Sen Diego Santa barbara by our car.There are shuttles to Disney and Anaheim.We are pleased to much for our 1 week say.
Manager Response: Merhaba Nucan,  Thank you very much for your recommendation of our hotel to other travelers. We are thrilled to hear that you had a great stay! Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback and for choosing us as your home during your visit to the U.S.   We appreciate your excellent ratings and compliments on our customer service. We hope to see you again on your next visit to the U.S.!  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: Everything looks good on paper - nice pictures on the website, free breakfast, free internet, close to attractions and separate bedrooms and living areas.  Couple that with the number 1 position for Buena Park for Trip Advisor and I was sold.  I have been meticulously planning our vacation for 2 years and I booked 13 nights in the hotel for my wife and our two children (5 and 2).  Here's the truth - both good and bad.    The hotel is located well, easy to get to from LAX, close the the freeway and Disney, and Buena Park doesn't feel as crowded as Anaheim (we have stayed 2x previously at the Hojo Anaheim which has been great).  We checked in at 11pm after a long flight from the UK and and reception staff were welcoming. They issued us a room right at the back of the property
Manager Response: Thank you for reaching out and writing your review.  We are sorry you were not satisfied with the accommodations of your room.  We will discuss the conditions of your room with our staff to ensure all guest rooms are up to Radisson standards.   We also apologize you did not enjoy breakfast.  Our goal is to ensure fresh food is provided and that each item is available for all of our guests.  If you would like to discuss your concern further, please call us directly at the hotel or you can email CCare@carlsonrezidor.com. ~Dana

Summary: This is a very appealing California style hotel. We stayed a week and visited all the theme parks in the area except Knots-berry Farm, which is very close. It has a very nice courtyard with lots of palm tree's and a pool and hot tub. Our room was on the ground floor right by the hot tub but the noise was never an issue. The staff were polite and efficient. The breakfast was FANTASTIC! The best breakfast we had at any hotel in the US, (and we've travelled allot). There was a chef on hand to make fresh eggs, or omelettes every morning. The gift store was great with much better prices than the theme parks or even the mall. Lots of parking even over Christmas, and the shuttle bus to Disney worked out so well for our big family. My only small criticism was their internet and
Manager Response: Hello Steve W,  Thank you for your comments and feedback. We are so pleased that you felt you got a great value during your recent stay and that our team was able to exceed your service expectations. On yoru next visit, you must allow time to attend both the Medieval Tiems and Pirates Dinner Adventure shows, you and your family will really enjoy both of the shows.  We hope to see you again when you visit your neighbor to the south and in particular to Buena Park, CA.  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary Heading: Good value within walking distance of knotts
Summary: Stayed for a couple of nights as we were visiting knotts berry farm and would rate this hotel as great value.  With the rooms being suites it suited us for the extra space and the sleep numbers beds were extremely comfortable.  Easy walking distance to knotts and the dinner show venues next door to the hotel.  Staff all very friendly and helpful.  Couple of negatives were firstly the breakfast, this felt like the rush for school dinners and all the rooms had bars on the external windows which was of putting on arrival.  Overall I would visit again if making a trip to knotts berry farm.
Manager Response: Hello Jgcbdsgte,  Thank you for your review of our hotel. I am very pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us and the convenience of our location. We look forward to having you as our guest again and hope to see you in the near future.  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: I was very pleased with the my stay here.  The price to quality ratio was very decent.  A true suite with actual separate living room with it's own television.  At such a cheap price. The staff was super helpful at all hours of the night and day! They went out of there way to help me get my job accomplished while there. I certainly loved my relaxing evenings in the jacuzzi and the quaint breakfast.  Although dated, the decoration was still tasteful and clean.  The lobby was welcoming in it's bonanza ponderosa kinda way.  I love the tile and would certainly love to have some hacienda in the desert with that floor.  I enjoyed one of the manager invites and ended with getting burger at the bar and some conversation with fellow travelers.
Manager Response: Hello Chad D,  We are so pleased you enjoyed your stay with us! We realize you have a choice of hotels when visiting the Buena Park area, the United States and greatly appreciate that you choose the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park.  We appreciate your excellent ratings and compliments about yoru stay with us. It truly is our pleasure to assist our guests in any way we can. We hope to see you again on your next visit to the U.S.!  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary Heading: An accommodating hotel with excellent staff!
Summary: This is my second time staying with radisson and once again I am very pleased. The rooms are great. Stayed with my friend once and again with my friend and her 4 kids. Plenty of space. Clean rooms. Breakfast is delicious. I went to knotts berry farm one day during my stay. When I arrived at the park, I didn't have my wallet. I called the front desk and they checked my room for me. They didn't find it so they called me back. They then informed the house keeping staff who also checked my room. They also called me to inform me they didn't find it. I ended up finding it in one of my bags after I returned to the hotel. They didn't go through my bag, which they shouldn't do because that's an invasion of privacy. But they did go to my room twice to look for it. How amazing is that?
Manager Response: Hello Smittin25,  Thank you very much for your recommendation of our hotel to other travelers. We are thrilled to hear that you had a great stay! Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback.   We appreciate your excellent ratings and compliments on our customer service. It truly is our pleasure to assist our guests in any way we can. We hope to see you again on your next visit to the Buena Park/Orange County area.  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: We stayed here back in April, but I forgot to leave a review.  We loved the atmosphere, nice pool, clean rooms and awesome free breakfast every morning!  Plus we got snacks and free cocktails in the evening.  Very close to Disney, just a jaunt down the freeway and a walk from Knotts!   We had two adults, two teens and a 5 yr old in our room and had plenty of room to spare.  We will be coming here again!
Manager Response: Hello Suzie D,  Many thanks for the review of our Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park, we note that you pointed out many of the reasons that travelers find us to be one of the best values in the area and the reason we have many return guests, it's wonderful to hear that your stay went so well and we hope to have you stay with us again!  Best Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: .....the best that can ever happen too you. We were able to adjust each site of the bed just perfectly to our own needs. I really had a good night sleep. Furthermore: the front desk employees are very helpful and all about service. Cleaning services are quick and good. Our room was quite big and nicely equipped. Only advice for the hotel: add pen and paper for your guests, tiny service with comes very handy. Overall: a good hotel, nice location, great beds and good service.
Manager Response: Hello Moniquedb1970,  It was a pleasure welcoming you as our guest. Thank you for taking the time to let fellow travelers know about the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park and for your kind words. I am pleased to learn that your overall experience was such a positive one.   Thank you for the missing pen and note pad to my attention, please note that I did mention to the housekeeping manager about this and we will strive to make sure that they are not missed in our rooms again. .   Again, thank you for your review and for choosing the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park. We hope to welcome you when you come back to the states again.   Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights in late November and were very pleased.  We booked online after reading tripadvisor reviews and comparing other hotels in both the Anaheim and Buena Park areas. The suite was roomy, beds were sleep number beds, very comfortable, and my 11 year old loved the pull out couch.  It was a little lumpy, but he did not mind.  The free hot breakfast was a big plus for us.  The pool area is cozy, and the pool is heated.  The staff was very nice and helpful.  We would stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello Phxdisney,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us and the other members of TripAdvisor. I am delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us here at the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park.   We hope to welcome you back again soon, please let us know if there is anything we can accommodate for you during your next stay.  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: After booking my room and reading reviews i was a bit nervous about my decision.  But I was pleasantly surprised with my room, my stay, and their breakfast!  My kids felt this is the best service we have ever had.  I would highly recommend this location I was extremely pleased with our overall experience at this location!
Manager Response: Hello Zdwyer,  Thank you for your recnt stay with us here at the Radisson Sites Hotel Buena Park. We are very pleased that you enjoyed our accommodations, amenities and location. Thank you for your review and we hope you will be back to visit again soon.  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: We are again very impressed with this well maintained older Spanish style  property. Gorgeous gardens lovely pool and hot tub area, 2 room suites with comfortable beds, staff is lovely and helpful.  There was no bellman, but average luggage carts were available in the lobby, and rooms were clean, and wifi works great.  We are currently here, and have just finished a nice dinner at Floras, their in-house restaurant. We will probably head out for a soak in the hot tub before bed. This is an "after cruise, Disney/Knotts" stay, we were here a week ago and had a terrific time as well.  The shuttle to Disneyland was free and worked well for us. (have to book in advance) The breakfast buffet is basic but if you walk farther back in the restaurant they will cook omelets and eggs to
Manager Response: Greetings AkGal43:  I am so pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us at the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park. We always strive to provide our valued guests with warm and welcoming experiences and I am glad that we continually exceed your expectations.   Thank you very much for taking the time to write this positive review about your experience and we look forward to seeing you again soon. Please contact us directly for any of your future reservation needs as we do greatly appreciate your loyalty to us.  Best Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: Staying in this Hotel was akin to staying at a self-service motel, while its restaurant for breakfast was definitely a throw-back to school days with hairnet/apron-wearing servers behind a stainless steel and glass-covered counter serving food on plates and trays.  It would rank average as a motel, but makes a poor hotel, with its bad service and misrepresentation.  Rooms and hallways were dated, and my husband had to kill a roach in the bath.  They served greasy cafeteria food for breakfast (hash browns, eggs, bacon, toast, whole slightly washed apples and unpeeled oranges).  We felt we could get a more satisfying and less expensive meal staying at a real motel and eating at McDonald's.  We arrived late in the evening, past 10, and had to bring all our luggage in from the
Manager Response: Dear Maddie A,  Thank you for staying with us during your visit to Buena Park and for giving us your feedback by completing the review on our property. As the only full service all suite hotel in Buena Park, I do apologize for our failing to meet and exceed your expectations in regards to our complimentary cook to order breakfast buffet, our suites, and customer service.   It should not be necessary but, occasionally; we must be reminded that we are in a highly competitive business where service is often the only distinguishing feature between us and our competition. Service is our business and I am terribly embarrassed that you weren‚Äôt treated as one would expect at a Radisson hotel.  Again, thank you for your comments and we hope to be of service to you in the future.  Sincerely,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: We spent 2 nights at this hotel right after Thanksgiving. The suites were very comfortable. The beds were sleep number beds. The living room had a pull out couch, tv, sink, desk and chair. There was still plenty of room to walk around. The king bed was comfortable and tv very nice.   There is a hot breakfast in the morning. It is very close to Knotts berry farm and next door to Medieval Times. We went to both. You can easily walk to both but there is a shuttle to Knotts and Disneyland.  The staff was friendly and helpful. There is a gift shop that has some essentials and souvenir items. They had a special on t shirts when we were there. It is closed from 1 to 5 pm. It opens at 7 am and closes for the night at 10 pm.  We will definitely stay here again. Everything was clean and
Manager Response: Hello Barbie47,  Thank you so much for writing this excellent review. I appreciate you taking the time to write about your experience and I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay.   We are so pleased that you enjoyed not only our amenities, but also convenient location to nearby attractions and restaurants. Another great feature of the free shuttle (aside from saving parking $) - avoiding the long, long lines at the parking structure and the tram to actually get into the park! We love making your vacations enjoyable, affordable and easy. Looking forward to your next visit to the Buena Park/Anaheim area.  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: Stayed here for 2nights and it was a good stay. The rooms were quite and the staff was friendly. I slept for 12hrs and I have NEVER done that at a hotel because usually I hear some sort of noise or knock on the door by housekeepers wanting to sevice my room. Or the bed and pillows are not comfortable etc. It's a good hotel and and I like the spanish style feel to it.
Manager Response: Hello Er_86,  Thank you for your review of our hotel. I am very pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us and the convenience of our location. We hope to have you as our guest again and hope to see you in the near future.  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary Heading: Excellent no need to search anywhere else
Summary: Wow - is the first words that come from me!  We had three rooms ground level pool view from the 13th to the 19th of November.  The staff was outstanding kudos go to Sam, Ramone, Roaa and Anthony, what you provided for our three familie's was extra customer service.  Everyone was great and the rooms were larger than we expected.  It was great to be able to go out all day and then put the children to bed and meet back out under the palm trees to laugh and talk.  The cleanliness was outstanding!!!!  Everyday we witnessed the cleaning staff doing something different - dusting the outside railing for cobwebs or whatever, taking covers of the lights and giving them a good cleaning, washing inside and outside windows and also hourly mopping of the first floor (only floor I was on).
Manager Response: Hello HF,  Thank you for taking the time to post your wonderful review. We are so pleased that you enjoyed the hotel, amenities, location, and service. As it is our goal to 'WoW' our guests in both service and amenities during each visit and each guest interaction, your review showed me that we did just that with you and your family members. Thank you for your feedback which helps us reach our goal.   I wil be sure to personally let Sam, Ramon, Doaa, Anthony and the housekeeping staff know that you truly appreciated their service and I want to say thank you to you for taking the time to bring this to our attention.   It sounds like you had an amazing and wonderful trip to Southern California and enjoyed all that there is to do in the area. Thank you for letting us be a part of your vacation and we look forward to your return visit.  Best Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights Tuesday-Friday and couldn't have been happier with our experiance.  The room was large and felt more like an apartment than a hotel, the furnishings were in good condition and didn't feel outdated or dirty.  The shuttered doors gave the room a great tropical feel vs cheap hotel.  We got there on a Tuesday and were lucky enough to enjoy their $1 taco night!!! the tacos were delicious! Each morning we enjoyed the full continental breakfast with eggs, potatos, fruit, etc, plus cooked to order fried eggs or omlettes.  The hotel pool was clean and big enough to handle the guests, plus had a REAL deep end! The grounds were gorgeous with tall mature landscaping that really gave the feeling that you were in a tropical oasis vs Buena Park.  The hotel
Manager Response: Hello Lindsyrox,  Thank you very much for your recommendation of our hotel to other travelers. We are thrilled to hear that you had a great stay! Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback. We appreciate your excellent ratings and compliments on our customer service. It truly is our pleasure to assist our guests in any way we can. We hope to see you again on your next visit to Buena Park!  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary Heading: Nice pool, but funny smell in rooms and bright fluorescent lights in room
Summary: We stayed here for less than 24 hours before checking into the Disney Land Hotel and I can see this as a decent bet if you are trying to save money.  The pool area was very pretty and had lush greens, and the free, hot breakfast was great.  I just think the rooms (at least ours on the second floor) need some updating.
Manager Response: Hello BrendaMen,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review concerning your recent stay with us at the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park.  I was sorry to read that we failed to meet your expectations in regards to the suites. I do hope that you reported the issues that you had to the front desk so we could correct those issues in that suite.   Please accept my apologies for your disappointment in the quality of our guest rooms and I can assure you that we strive to do a better job.  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: I had stayed at this hotel several times in the past and would highly recomend it in the past, allthough I hadnt stayed for the past three years and I must say what a change. I was very unhappy with the cooked to order breakfast it was very very disorganized. I remember when the staff was very friendly well not anymore. Not sure I will stay here again. I will say our room was very clean and comfortable. Very Convenient location.
Manager Response: Hello Steve C,  I am very sorry to hear that though your overall stay was pleasant this past time at the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park, that you felt that the complimentary cook to order breakfast buffet did not meet your expectations in regards to organization and friendly staff.   We do value the comments and feedback of all of our guests to ensure we can make The Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park the best place to stay. I have noted your comments and these matters were discussed and addressed with the food and beverage manager.   We take pride in our hotel, customer service, and attention to details to ensure our guest have the best experience here, so again your comments will be addressed. We hope that you do give our hotel the opportunity to host you again while visiting the Buena Park/Orange County area.   Thank you for aloowing the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park to host your family during your travels to Buena Park.  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: This hotel has a very convenient location. The suite that we had was just right for our family of five.   The bed was comfy but kind of old. Bathroom was ok. Our room was on the first floor in front of the dining area and on the other side was a parking lot and the only noise that we heard was the footsteps of the people on the second floor. There was a limited selection of breakfast but it gets crowded at times. Staff was kind.  This hotel looks like it was around for sometime already but it is properly maintained.  Price is just right and very near Knotts Berry Farm.  This is a good place for a family on a  budget.
Manager Response: Hello Chummy12_12,  It was a pleasure welcoming you as our guest. Thank you for taking the time to let fellow travelers know about the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park and for your kind words. I am pleased to learn that your overall experience was such a positive one.   Again, thank you for your review and for choosing the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park. We hope to welcome you again very soon.  Warmest Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary Heading: We had a great stay I will definatley reccomend to family and friends!
Summary: We stayed here four nights on our family Disneyland trip. Our party had three rooms with eight people total. All of our rooms were nice and clean. They come with a living area with a nice flat screen tv, couchbed kitchen sink fridge, microwave and dining table. The bedroom also has a nice tv. There is a door to seperate the bedroom and bathroom from the living room. The free breakfast and pool were excellent. The staff was also great! Our shuttle driver Valerie was awesome she went out of her way to get us lunch on our way back to the hotel after our first day at Disneyland. We had a great stay! Thank you for helping make our trip a memorable one!  The Nokes Family.
Manager Response: Hello Mnokes33,  It was an honor having you as a guest of Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park. Thank you for your positive review of the hotel service as well as the various accommodations and amenities offered.   I am privileged to work with an amazing team and will be sure to pass along your comments concerning Valerie to both Valerie and her manager. Without such an awesome staff, we wouldn't be able to provide the outstanding service to you our guests.   We hope to welcome you again soon.  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: Three of us stayed at this Radisson in October to visit Disneyland. The location is very nice as you can walk to many restaurants and even Knott's Berry Farm. They offer a scheduled shuttle to the theme parks and a cook-to-order breakfast.  The hotel is set up around a courtyard with a tropical feel and a nice pool & hot tub. The rooms open up to the courtyard and have outside doors & walkways. While this looks pretty, it's not very good for a sound sleep if you happen to draw the short straw and have to sleep on the small sofa bed in the living area.  I know it's part of the great Disney experience to be surrounded by kids - but it's not very nice for parents to allow them to thunder down the walkways and scream at 6am!  The service upon check in was swift and friendly. They
Manager Response: Hello TravelgoddessofAAA,  It was a pleasure welcoming you as our guest. Thank you for taking the time to let fellow travelers know about the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park and for your kind words. I am pleased to learn that your overall experience was such a positive one.   Please let me apologize for the kids running down the hallways and I am glad that you didn't let such an experience take away from your vacation.   Again, thank you for your review and for choosing the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park. We hope to welcome you again very soon.  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: This hotel was offered to us from my mother-in-law using her RCI points. It was a great offer by her.  We checked in on Saturday and was given a suite with 2 double beds. That was not very comfortable for my husband and I so we asked on Sunday if we can be moved, and they quickly made that happen for us. The rooms were clean, nice, and overall kept up to date. They have a fridge, microwave, and extra sink in the kitchenette, that was very handy for us.  During our stay we had a few questions and needed some help with touristy things and we found that Sam and Ramon were very helpful, polite and more than I was expecting.  We had full free breakfast every morning, that was very good.   The only comment I have is the equipment in the fitness centre needs to be maintained better.
Manager Response: Hello Tanya N,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We are so pleased that you enjoyed the hotel, amenities, location, and service (with one exception, the exercise room). We will be addressing the issue you mentioned, as it is our goal to 'WoW' our guests in both service and amenities during each visit and each guest interaction.   I am delighted, but not surprised, to hear that Ramon and Sam took good care of you and I will pass on your comments to our management team as well as personally to Sam and Ramon.  Thank you again for your feedback as this is the only way we can ensure our customer service levels are where they should be. We do hope you will consider staying with us again.  Warm Regards,  Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: We are a family of 4 from Australia. The Hotel was exactly what we needed for our 10 night stay. Friendly, helpful staff, free breakfast, cheap/free drinks, great food @ restaurant, comfortable beds. The poolside suite we had was larger than we expected, and we thoroughly enjoyed the pool and spa after a hard day's sightseeing and theme parks. We always felt safe and it was great to have the Mall only 10mins walk away. Great to have the wireless access, laundry and ATM also. Room cleaned very well everyday. The staff organised our tours and transfers for us and were always helpful. Free buses to Disneyland safe and convenient. My kids are already asking when are we going back? Thoroughly recommended for young families. Aussies and NZers, check it out. We had the best holiday

Summary Heading: nice hotel, nice location at great prices

Experience when checking at 5:30 was quick and efficient we were offered a room on the third floor, 341. which was roomy enough for three adults with sleep number beds. Apparently if you want this kind of bed this is the only floor that has it. idk if this is true or not, but it was not a major issue. This hotel offers managers' reception Mon to Thurs from 5:30 to 7:30 free drinks and nachos with salsa, potato chips and party pretzels. As the day progressed, they have different menu at discounted prices, but the beer and wine are still free, which was excellent to start your night. I think max they give out free, are 3 drinks after that you have to pay. The buffet breakfast was another
Manager Response: Hello Pokerjacker,  Thank you for choosing the Radisson Suites Hotel Buena Park! That alone saved us $15 a day in parking fees at Disneyland.  They also offered a free breakfast buffet.  I found the quality to be better than many hotels that offer free breakfast.  One day they had made to order omlettes, and another day they made cook to order eggs.  There is nothing bad I can say about this hotel.  It

Called the front desk and was told the air would only work if we were in the room (energy saver something or other). Anyway, the air conditioning NEVER came on! We were miserable all night. Then there were the mattresses...OMG, they were awful! The sofa bed was even worse! My poor kid was basically sleeping on a slightly padded sheet on top of metal springs! Summary: Business trip to SoCal for client golf tournament in Orange County. We never had problem with finding a parking spot despite our late night return to the hotel. driving is easy, roads are good and everything is pretty close by if you dont mind driving and exploring, a good GPS does magic, the roads, the traffic all part of the LA adventure I guess. The hotel itself is very good, the staff excellent,

We did not experience any of the worn out furniture that other travelers complained about. Our sleep number beds worked properly. All of the areas were clean. The room didn't have any off odors. In case this matters, we were in room 333 (third floor) toward the back by the restaurant.  Speaking of the restaurant, it was perfectly adequate. The best thing about the free daily breakfast was the made-to-order omelette or fried eggs. The buffet part was mostly good.

The room was large, comfortable and spotless.  We found the customer service excellent; room service was prompt and the room was always clean and ready in the afternoon when we returned. The gardens are well kept and we enjoyed the pool after a 14 hour flight.  We did tire of breakfast after about the third day, but it is free so we certainly wouldn't complain. It is centrally located and an easy walk to Knotts and other attractions. The pool area is nice because it is not closed in and has vegetation surrounding it. The hotel is also just around the corner from the Buena Park mall, the Wax Museum is also just down the street and too far from any beach.  I recommend this hotel!!!

If your looking for a quiet getaway, this is not it. There is a lot of activity in the pool area. The room was nice enough and had a sleep number bed that didn't start working until we had couple visits by the maintenance staff. The one thing I couldn't get past was the living area of the room felt like an office and the furniture to sit in was not very comfortable. The customer service was top notch and the breakfast had a decent variety of food. I think if we were to go to the Buena Park area again, I'd probably consider staying elsewhere for a couples getaway.

We also really enjoyed the sleep number bed!!! Cons: As stated in other reviews, the rooms really need to be updated!  The pool was closed for almost an entire day and the hot-tub for a time as well.  The water was pretty cloudy as it gets plenty of use from families. The breakfast is on par with any other "free" breakfast service you would expect from a Holiday Inn etc. The omelettes were the best to eat, the other food was very sub par.  The hotel surprisingly has excellent food made to order in its kitchen for room service and eat in at the bar. Kudos to the cook for the excellent food. The swimming pool was a weird yellow/green color, not sure if this was from

I was told that it use to be an Embassy Suite which makes sense since the rooms our all suites and it has a interior courtyard that houses a nice pool, exercise room, and restaurant where the free breakfast and happy hour (M-T) is held.  Our room was on he second floor.  You can either take the elevator or stairs to get there.  We entered our room and it really wasn't what I expected considering the hotel was ranked #1 on Tripadivsor for Buena Park hotels.  The room smelt damp.

It is good value for money if the stay is not very
