Please contact us directly for any of your future reservation needs as we do greatly appreciate your loyalty to us.  Best Regards, Dennis Banks Director of Sales & Marketing

Summary: Nice spacious rooms, clean and in good repair.  Two flat screen tv's (one in the lounge area and one in the bedroom).   Rate paid was fair and the reception staff were helpful and polite.  They kept us waiting for a room on check in as they were not ready for occupation, but managed to eventually get us in by checking with housekeeping where a room was available. Only gripe we had was with the breakfast which was a bun fight!!  Self-service was available for scrambled eggs, french toast, grits, but bacon, sausage, fried eggs were to order at a seperate bar.  The poor man frying the food was frazzled himself!!  I watched him cook 9 omlettes at a time!  Often people just took the food from the counter instead of checking if it was their order!  I did it myself at one point as I
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay in a great hotel!
Summary: We stayed for 5 nights during the first week in June. I am a Club Carlson member and used my points for my stay. We were primarily there for Disneyland/California Adventures but we did have a couple of days where we did some touring/beaches. The rooms are very accomadating, especially if you have kids. We have 3 and having the extra bed was extremely helpful! There is also a microwave and refrigerator in the room which can help for drinks or sandwiches. The only slight problem we had was our bathroom door. It would keep getting stuck when trying to open or close it. The restaurant was wonderful. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make srue we had everything we needed. Sun-Thurs they have snacks and free drinks (this includes alcoholic beverages) during
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a great hotel to stay at if you are visiting Knotts Berry Farm or even Disneyland. The hotel is conveniently located a few blocks from Knotts Berry Farm. The staff was friendly and accomodating. The rooms were clean and came with a sleep number bed, and a separate living room with second TV. The complimentary breakfast was decent and there was plenty of seating. The hotel felt like a mini resort.  We would defintely stay there again. The price and quality was terrific!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We (family of four) stayed here for 4 nights in May 2011. We loved it! The rooms are set up as suites, free cooked breakfast, free wireless internet, free parking. The rooms are not your typical Radisson, i.e. carpet was wrinkled in a few places in the room and a light fixture in the bathroom was cracked but honestly, these things did not impact our stay at all. If we ever return to Anaheim, we will stay at this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Place!  Would like to come again
Summary: We stayed in the hotel for 6 nights in 3 times from 27 April to 6 May, 2011.  First day we reached at around 11.45 AM, before check in time, but were given a suite with King Size bed, coffee maker, microwave, etc.  There is a wash basin near the cooking area.  It has got plenty of greenery. Free breakfast is also good.  French toast, omelet, scrambled eggs, potatoes, toast, milk, juices and fruits were there for breakfast.  We are not aware that they offered free evening tea/snacks, nor were informed.  There is a big shopping mall about 1 mile from  the hotel.  We could get vegetarian Indian food from a nearby restaurant Neelkamal.    ATM located in the gift shop was not working.  Laundry is good and cost $1.25 for washing and $1.25 for dryer.  Soap is for $1.  Swimming pool is
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Overall great hotel, service and location..great deals too!
Summary: Just as pics showed, very clean.  If you are traveling w kids and they will be sleeping in the pullout couch, ask for a room further back away from pool, very noisy, but not in main room.  Our kids were very sick and they were very helpful.  Store nice to have but most times we went down they were on break or away and you'd have to go back.  Target and Walgreens nearby too.  Close to various food places too.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Family of 5 plus a grandma.  Kids are girls, ages 15, 14, 11.  Stayed 6 nights in April, Sunday thru Saturday.  Had the advance purchase reservation, which saves tons of money over standard reservations.  This is where you reserve 21 days in advance or more, and pay in full at time of reservation, in order to get a LARGE discount.  I thought you had to do this through Radisson directly, but heard later that the travel agent could do this also.  Anyway, the original reservation was only for M-Sa, but we arrived a day ahead, and on the way I called and spoke to the manager, who was able to add another night at the advance purchase discount.  With the advance purchase, the room averaged to about $87/night, where the normal price was something like $120-130/night.  We were very
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife,son and I recently stayed at the Radisson for 6 nights. The hotel had an inviting entrance and spacious lobby area with a gift shop that carried a good range of products at reasonable prices. The counter staff were helpful and friendly. The gift shop had a money machine that was out of order for the entire six days...........This was a real inconvience. The room was spacious but a tad dark and a bit tired in the decor dept. However, it was clean and the beds.... although only doubles........were very comfortable with clean and fresh linen. Our first cleaner was a bit slack but the second cleaner was brillant and the tip went up accordingly. The breakfast was a large selection of poor quality food. The bread was smelly.........and not in a good way.....Judging that every
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great complementary breakfast and evening snacks!
Summary: Our whole family of five stayed four nights at this hotel and loved it (except for my wife).  Our children (8, 5, and 1 year old) enjoyed the heated swimming pool and hot tub surrounded by lush vegetation reminiscent of Hawaii.  The suites are spacious and and accomodated our large family well.  I enjoyed sitting by the water fountain every morning to read my Bible and smoke a smooth cigar.  The complementary breakfast is more than you'd find at most other hotels, and includes made to order omlettes.  The evening included free drinks and finger food like veggie pot stickers.  However, my wife complained about the fold out bed being hard, being woken up by the noise at the pool at night and birds in the morning.  She also says that the weight machine didn't work well and the food
Manager Response: none

Summary: Beautifully landscaped grounds. Free cooked-to-order breakfast.  Free well drinks from bar during happy hour.  Room service. 4-story building with exterior corridors and elevators. Two-room suites; wet bar; microwave, refrigerator, sofa; 2 HDTVs.  Sleep Number brand electronically adjustable king bed.  Free parking; free wired and wireless internet. Pool; jacuzzi; exercise room.  Banquet and meeting facilities.  Pool table and video arcade games in game room.  Near restaurants, tourist attractions (Knott's Berry Farm, Disneyland). Shuttle bus.

Summary: My mom traveled with us, and is a housekeeper and so we looked for the small things that tend to be missed like hair and such and found NONE!! Room was clean and after a bad start to a long trip they "fixed" the bed issue by changing out the hide a way mattress for one with more stuffing. We went through towels like water and never had any issues with getting more no matter what time of day or night. The breakfast could be a feeding frenzy during "normal" breakfast hours(9am-10am) however we went early first thing and never had any issues. Staff was very helpful and never seemed to mind any request we had even when we changed or missed our shuttle times. We had a rental car but was glad we used the shuttle. The drivers were very friendly and helpful making us double check that
Manager Response: none

Summary: In February we spent a week in southern California. We stayed both in Burbank and in Del Mar, but we finished of with staying four nights in Buena Park.  We stayed at this hotel 3 years ago, and we had high expectations when we arrived. Even so the hotel had a nice surprise ready for us at arrival when they told us that the breakfast was inluded (it was not at the time og booking). The rooms was just as spacious as we rememberd, and the brakefast was even better. As an example, they serve your eggs the way you order them. The breakfast also included bacon, sausages, pancakes, cereals, you name it. Even my daughter, who are quite picky, found several things that tasted good every day. We did not have any other meals at Flora, but the restaurant is open every night, and the even

Summary Heading: Not bad if closer hotels to Disney are booked out...
Summary: We travelled here with our four year old daughter to visit Disney. All hotels within walking distance of the park were booked.  The hotel runs a free shuttle to the park, which takes around 15 minutes. That's a bit more hassle than walking, but not too much more.  The rooms are spacious (lounge area and separate bedroom), the breakfast (included) is good, there's plenty of parking and the access is easy.

Summary: Our family was in town for a trip to Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm.
